intro: Borreria scabra, commonly known as the rough borreria, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers and hairy, often woody stems. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Borreria scabra is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
